page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content:
HOUSING. There are very small villages with a mixture of old cottages, renovated and extended, and larger new buildings all in very good repair, and a number of scattered farm houses throughout the lowland area and along the lower slopes of the hills, but no habitation in the moorland or mountain region of the section.
TRANSPORT (Roads). There are a network of 'B class' narrow roads and lanes, single track in places, with infrequent passing places, linking the villages, and reasonable roads, giving access to the larger farms, but only one road over the mountain area between the A541 and the tiny village of Pentre'r Felin, this is narrow, winding and very steep in places, but in good condition.
